stimulusHtml: The freestanding female figures associated with the Parthenon, including the now-lost chryselephantine statue of Athena and the surviving Peplos Kore, have which of the following in common?

features.html: Â© SGM / The Bridgeman Art Library

choicesHtml: They both functioned as religious images and offerings made to a deity.
They broth represented goddesses beckoning with empty, outstretched hands.
They were both created on a colossal scale to impress worshippers.
They both stood as guardian figures at the entrance of the temple.
